senses.sense_definition: An abandoned house or building, often used for illegal activities such as selling drugs.

examples.text: The police raided the <w>bando</w> at the end of the street after receiving complaints from neighbors.
He spent several nights sleeping in the <w>bando</w> because he had nowhere else to go.

senses.sense_definition: A traditional Burmese martial art that emphasizes self-defense and uses both open hands and weapons.

examples.text: She has been practicing <w>bando</w> for five years to improve her discipline and agility.
The instructor demonstrated a complex defensive technique used in <w>bando</w>.

senses.sense_definition: A traditional team sport from Wales played with curved sticks and a ball, similar to hockey.

examples.text: In the nineteenth century, <w>bando</w> was a popular pastime in many rural Welsh villages.
The rules of <w>bando</w> allow players to strike the ball with considerable force across the field.

senses.sense_definition: The curved wooden stick used to play the game of bando.

examples.text: He carved his own <w>bando</w> out of a piece of tough ash wood.
A player must not raise the <w>bando</w> above shoulder height during the match.
